backend.src.app.routes.rentals package

Submodules

backend.src.app.routes.rentals.rentals_route module

class backend.src.app.routes.rentals.rentals_route.RentalCloseRouter(api=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Resource

Router for handling operations related to closing a specific rental record.

Provides a handler for HTTP PUT requests made to the ‘/rentals/rental/<id>/close’ endpoint.

methods: t.ClassVar[t.Optional[t.Collection[str]]] = {'PUT'}

The methods this view is registered for. Uses the same default (["GET", "HEAD", "OPTIONS"]) as route and add_url_rule by default.

put(id)[source]

Closes a specific rental record by ID.

This method requires a JWT token and the ID of the rental. It creates a RentalController instance with the provided ID and attempts to validate the rental and close it.

Parameters:

id (int) – The ID of the rental.

Returns:

A response object containing a successful closure message.

Return type:

tuple[dict[str, str], int]

Raises:

ControllerException – If the rental does not exist or if the provided fees data is invalid.

Bases: Resource

Router for handling operations related to a specific rental record’s description.

Provides a handler for HTTP PUT requests made to the ‘/rentals/rental/<id>/description’ endpoint.

methods: t.ClassVar[t.Optional[t.Collection[str]]] = {'PUT'}

The methods this view is registered for. Uses the same default (["GET", "HEAD", "OPTIONS"]) as route and add_url_rule by default.

put(id)[source]

Updates a specific rental record’s description by ID.

This method requires a JWT token and the ID of the rental. It creates a RentalController instance with the provided ID and attempts to validate the rental and update the description.

Parameters:

id (int) – The ID of the rental.

Returns:

A response object containing a successful update message.

Return type:

tuple[dict[str, str], int]

Raises:

ControllerException – If the rental does not exist or if the provided description data is invalid.

class backend.src.app.routes.rentals.rentals_route.RentalRouter(api=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Resource

Router for handling operations related to a specific rental record.

Provides handlers for HTTP GET and DELETE requests made to the ‘/rentals/rental/<id>’ endpoint.

delete(id)[source]

Deletes a specific rental record by ID.

This method requires a JWT token and the ID of the rental. It creates a RentalController instance with the provided ID and attempts to validate and delete the rental.

Parameters:

id (int) – The ID of the rental.

Returns:

A response object containing a successful deletion message.

Return type:

tuple[dict[str, str], int]

Raises:

ControllerException – If the rental does not exist.

get(id)[source]

Retrieves a specific rental record by ID.

This method requires a JWT token and the ID of the rental. It creates a RentalController instance with the provided ID and attempts to validate the rental.

Parameters:

id (int) – The ID of the rental.

Returns:

A response object containing the rental data.

Return type:

tuple[dict[str, str], int]

Raises:

ControllerException – If the rental does not exist.

methods: t.ClassVar[t.Optional[t.Collection[str]]] = {'DELETE', 'GET'}

The methods this view is registered for. Uses the same default (["GET", "HEAD", "OPTIONS"]) as route and add_url_rule by default.

class backend.src.app.routes.rentals.rentals_route.RentalsRouter(api=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Resource

Router for handling operations related to rental.

Provides handlers for HTTP GET and POST requests made to the ‘/rentals/’ endpoint.

get()[source]

Retrieves all rental data.

This method requires a JWT token. It creates a RentalsController instance and then generates a response containing data about all rentals.

Returns:

A response object containing a list of all rental data.

Return type:

tuple[list[dict[str, any]], int]

methods: t.ClassVar[t.Optional[t.Collection[str]]] = {'GET', 'POST'}

The methods this view is registered for. Uses the same default (["GET", "HEAD", "OPTIONS"]) as route and add_url_rule by default.

post()[source]

Creates a new rental.

This method requires a JWT token and the rental data in the request body. It creates a RentalsController instance with the request data and attempts to create a new rental.

Returns:

A response object containing a success message or an error message if an error occurs.

Return type:

tuple[dict[str, str], int]

Raises:

ControllerException – If an error occurs while creating the rental.

class backend.src.app.routes.rentals.rentals_route.RentalsSortRouter(api=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Resource

Router for handling the operation related to sorting rental data.

Provides a handler for HTTP GET requests made to the ‘/rentals/sort’ endpoint.

get()[source]

Retrieves sorted rental data.

This method requires a JWT token and the sort parameters in the query string. It creates a RentalsSortController instance with the request arguments and attempts to sort the rental data.

Returns:

A response object containing a list of sorted rental data.

Return type:

tuple[list[dict[str, any]], int]

Raises:

ControllerException – If an error occurs while sorting the rental data.

methods: t.ClassVar[t.Optional[t.Collection[str]]] = {'GET'}

The methods this view is registered for. Uses the same default (["GET", "HEAD", "OPTIONS"]) as route and add_url_rule by default.
